definition: Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Dong
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to move forward/to promote/to advance

sentences.english: Commander-in-chief that Eastern Jin set up has intimate relations with generals.
sentences.chinese: 東晉國家設置的都督諸州軍事與將軍職有密切的關係。

sentences.english: During the Eastern Jin Dynasty, there was an old fisherman in Wuling.
sentences.chinese: 東晉年間，武陵有一個老漁夫。

sentences.english: The formation of the Fulao people of South Fujian can be divided into two periods-the Dongjin—Tang period and the Song dynasty period.
sentences.chinese: 閩南福佬人的形成分爲東晉至唐和宋代兩個時期。

sentences.english: In the period of East Jin Dynasty, the Buddhist theory of intuitive wisdom prevails in China.
sentences.chinese: 東晉時期，中觀般若理論在中國達到高峯。

sentences.english: The record about Pictures of Classic of Mountains and Seas is after Dongjing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 關於《山海經》圖的記錄均是東晉以後的記載。

sentences.english: Hui Yuan was a great Buddhist scholar in mid-late period of East Jin Dynasty after Dao An.
sentences.chinese: 慧遠是東晉中後期繼道安之後的一代佛學大師。

sentences.english: All these pushed story of Eastern Jin to a boom.
sentences.chinese: 它們互相爭奇鬥豔，共同推動了東晉小說的繁榮。

sentences.english: Jin is too yuan, Wuling people fishing for the industry.
sentences.chinese: 東晉太元年間，有個武陵人以捕魚作爲職業。

sentences.english: The setting power was strictly controlled by the country.
sentences.chinese: 東晉國家嚴格控制征討都督的設置權力。

sentences.english: Lan Ting poetic creation of the Eastern Jin Dynasty dated from a new aesthetic idea of mountains and rivers.
sentences.chinese: 東晉蘭亭詩的創作源於一種新的山水審美觀念。

sentences.english: The appearance of poet monks was just like "the spring wind arriving suddenly overnight".
sentences.chinese: 東晉詩僧的出現，忽如一夜春風來。

sentences.english: Emigrant state and county were widely set in the Eastern Jin Dynasty and the Southern Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 東晉南朝時代，僑州郡縣普遍設置乃至成爲一種制度。

definition: Eastern or later Han dynasty, 25-220
Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
Gu Kaizhi or Ku K'aichih (346-407), famous painter of Eastern Jin dynasty, one of the Four Great Painters of the Six Dynasties 六朝四大家
the Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
Liu Yu, founder of Song of the Southern dynasties 劉宋|刘宋[Liu2 Song4], broke away from Eastern Jin in 420, reigned as Emperor Wu of Song 宋武帝[Song4 Wu3 di4]
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Qi of the Northern Dynasties (550-557)
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
Wei (220-265) and Jin (265-420) dynasties
Jin Dynasty (265-420)
Kumarajiva c. 334-413, Buddhist monk and translator of Zen texts
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
to number the years/calendar era/annals/chronicle

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
